Package com.example.collectqr

Class DbCollection<T extends DbDocument>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.collectqr.DbCollection<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of document stored in the collection
    public class DbCollection<T extends DbDocument>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a collection within Firestore along with some helper methods

      • getById

        public T getById​(java.lang.String id,
                 T data)
        Gets a document from the collection by its generated id
        Parameters:
        id - The generated id of the document within Firestore
        data - An instance of the document type for casting purposes
        Returns:
        Returns the document if found or null

      • update

        public T update​(T data)
        Updates a document within the Firestore
        Parameters:
        data - The new data for the document
        Returns:

      • add

        public T add​(T data)
        Adds a new document to the collection
        Parameters:
        data - The document to add
        Returns:

        Deletes a specified document within the collection if it exists
        Parameters:
        id - The generated id of the document to delete
        Returns:
        Returns the task for deleting the document

      • FindUser

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> FindUser​(java.lang.String username)
        A function to check whether a username exists in the database
        Parameters:
        username - The username that we want to find
        Returns:

      • CheckUser

        public boolean CheckUser​(java.lang.String username)
        A function to return a User object corresponding with a username
        Parameters:
        username - The username that we want to check for
        Returns:
        A boolean, true if that username is being used, false otherwise

      • searchSuggestions

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> searchSuggestions​(java.lang.String username)
        A function to check for usernames that begin with what was queried
        Parameters:
        username - The username fragment that is being searched
        Returns:
        Returns an array list containing all users that begin with the username fragment
